trial_identification.studytitle: Trial of the Patney open airway device for snoring and mild obstructive sleep apnoea
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Validation trial of the Patney open airway device in snorers and mild obstructive sleep apnoea - subjective report of comfort and outcomes

interventions.interventions: The Patney OAD is a pillow device designed to open the airway and reduce snoring / obstructive sleep apnoea. It will be used each night during a period of sleep over one week at subjects home. Detailed instructions will be provided by WellSleep staff trained in its use. Subjects and their partners will provide subjective feedback on their experience.
interventions.comparator: Control is usual practice with regards to current pillow

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sleep quality from the use of likert scales (1-10). The questionnaire is an in-house questionnaire designed specifially for this study.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After one week of device use

primaryOutcome.outcome: Average total sleep time from sleep diary - in house questionnaire
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Each night over the one week trial with the product

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Snoring level - sujectively measured by partner sleeping in same bed. This will be on a likert scale and compare to usual snoring.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: After one week of device use

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Comfort of device. Determined by in house questionnaire designed for this study.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: after one week of device use

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Objectively determined snoring (snoring plus apnoea Index < 5 /hr) or mild OSA (Apnoea index 5-15/hr) Not using any other treatment for snoring/mild OSA Partner sleeping in same bed
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Musculoskeletal issues Severe OSA Separate sleeping arrangements Use of other treatment for snoring / mild OSA

fundingsource.fundingaddress: c/- BDO Waikati 1026 Victoria St Hamilton 3200 New Zealand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Treatment devices for snoring and mild OSA available over the counter have not been well validated. This study aims to determine whether a new product - the Patney Open Airway Device is suitable for people who snore and have mild OSA in terms of treating these issues. Patients will initially trial the device for one week and provide feedback on the comfort of the device plus the effect on symptoms.
